turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um so I <UNIN/>, so my um my brother has had, actually had something like this for um <UNIN/> he has it as well for five days, as well. Um and I I've, I'm not, yeah I <UNIN/> I can't think of what, what the trigger is for me. I mean, my brother normally can deal, deals with this stuff a lot better than me. But <UNIN/>, yeah I, that's why

turns.text: Um

turns.speaker: PATIENT

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright. Are you having anything to eat or drink? Have you, I can see you're drinking a coffee, but are you keeping it down? Are you keeping your fluids down?

turns.text: Um so it just feels like the, the fluids do go down. But it just feels like it's going straight through.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: It just feels like it's going straight through.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: But again it just it <UNIN/> just came, come out pretty loose.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright. Um and and Dan, moving forwards, are you otherwise fit and well, or do you have any other medical history?

turns.text: Um, so I um, yeah I think, I think otherwise I'm fit and well. I um

turns.text: Yeah I mean I, I'm an OK weight. And um, I I can't think of any related medical history.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I mean like my, yeah I <UNIN/> no I <UNIN/> I don't think so.

turns.text: Um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Well thank you for <UNIN/> me. That's really helpful to know. So um, Dan, just as a a conclusion, uh um, just to wrap it all up, I think your symptoms are suggestive of something called gastroenteritis.

turns.text: OK.

turns.text: bit of a basic infection of your tummy. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. There's nothing to worry about. Uh um uh uh I suspect this will just settle down in the next few days.

turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Just like you did for you brother. Drink, make sure you drink plenty of fluids, OK? And you can <UNIN/>

turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> Do i need like a prescription for that?

turns.text: <UNIN/> no, you can just get that over the counter.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, you can try just you know regular Paracetamol if you are feeling feverish. But if your symptoms aren't settling down in the next couple of days, so forty eight hours, I want you to give me a call back.

turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.text: Because um, you know if you are getting dehydrated then we need to do further investigations, OK? But I think let's, let's see how you are in the next one to two days.

turns.text: OK. So you're saying that I should, <UNIN/> I could, uh I'll try and buy this Dioralyte. What, what should I do in terms of um, food and that kind of thing? Should I just focus on fluids?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> clear fluids. You can use soft diet, things like soup, mash. And then gradually build up, um as much as your body can tolerate.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Absolutely. If you are having, if you've got a bit of tummy pain, if you're feeling feverish, then I think Paracetamol is very sensible.
